Table 2Reported Responses to Crises

Gay Responses to Crises
Gay men reported their primary ways of dealing with crises were to exclude partners from decision making (cited by 17 men) and to assure themselves their decisions were fair (cited by 18).
Exclusion of Partner. Fully 85 percent of the men reported avoiding communicating with partners, and only one man mentioned talking with his partner during a crisis. Accounts identified three excluding strategies: unilateral decision making, confrontation, and going to outsiders for personal support.
